law.catch_line: Before a public body awards a construction contract exceeding $100,000, the contractor shall provide...

section.section: Before a public body awards a construction contract exceeding $100,000, the contractor shall provide payment security and performance security that meet the requirements of § 17-104 of this subtitle.

The security shall be:
for performance security, in an amount that the public body considers adequate for its protection; and
for payment security, at least 50% of the total amount payable under the contract.

text.section:
A public body, other than the State or a unit of the State government, may require payment security or performance security for a construction contract if:
the contract exceeds $25,000 but does not exceed $100,000; and
the amount of the security does not exceed 50% of the contract amount.
